metadata.title: Densmore's Nootka and Quileute music
metadata.description: A collection of folksongs from several First Nations. The songs  were collected by Frances Densmore in 1923 and 1926 and published  in her 1949 *Nootka and Quileute Music*. Digital encoding by  Daniel and Eva Shanahan.

issues.title: Songs missing
issues.description: Not all songs seem to have been encoded: Densmore lists 210  songs, of which 133 have been encoded.

issues.title: Publication preview urls are wrong
issues.description: HathiTrust uses a 'page scan sequence' number in the url. We  compute this by adding some number to the page number, but  it seems that this doesn't always work... Is there another query param that we can use to select the page?

songs.title: Song Conserning the Whale Which Could Not Be Eaten
songs.lyrics_translation: The oil of this whale is red because the little bird has made it so.

songs.title: Song Concerning the Eatable Whale
songs.lyrics_translation: We got this whale because the little bird was not at home

songs.title: Song of the Married Man Who Became a Whaler
songs.lyrics_translation: Go into that bay, that is the path (meaning the landing place of the canoe)

songs.title: Song to Make a Wounded Whale Swim Toward Shore
songs.lyrics_translation:
Use your other flipper.
Paddle toward our home.

songs.title: Song of Gathering at Which Fin Was Displayed
songs.lyrics_translation:
I come in,
I am rolling (not walking) but I am a man

songs.title: "I Come to the Land"
songs.lyrics_translation:
Here I come from way out, to the land,
To visit as many places as I can.

songs.title: A Whale Returns
songs.lyrics_translation: I am coming back to be caught again

songs.title: Song of a Whale
songs.lyrics_translation:
I have come to see how your house is,
Is it prepared for large crowds?

songs.title: Song of the Oil Potlatch
songs.lyrics_translation: Here I have come to the place where people live

songs.title: Dance Song of the Young Women
Song of Invitation to a Potlatch
Song of the Guests in Their Canoes
comments: The drum and voice use different tempi

songs.title: Song of a Guest at a Potlatch
comments: The drum and voice use different tempi: voice=72, drum=84

songs.title: Song of the Kwikwatla Dance
comments: "It was accompanied by pounding with sticks on a large box, this being done by the assembly"

songs.title: Song of the Host at a Potlatch
Song Before Distribution of Gifts (a)
comments: On the previous page, Densmore writes that "the next two songs [...] are accompanied by a rapid beating of sticks on plancks, and the dancers clapped their hands sharply at the accented tones of the song"
songs.lyrics_translation: I am wealthy, that is why I am singing

songs.title: Song Before Distribution of Gifts (b)
comments: On the previous page, Densmore writes that "the next two songs [...] are accompanied by a rapid beating of sticks on plancks, and the dancers clapped their hands sharply at the accented tones of the song"
songs.lyrics_translation: It is I who am dancing

songs.title: "Mine is a Proud Village"
songs.lyrics_translation:
Mine is a proud village, such as it is,
We are at our best when dancing.

songs.title: Song of the Women Guests
songs.lyrics_translation: We have come to see what you have to give away at your potlatch

songs.title: "The Rattle is my Tumanos"
songs.lyrics_translation: I am rich because the rattle is my tumanos

songs.title: Potlatch Song
songs.lyrics_translation: It is too bad about the presents that I and the other men were so pleased about

songs.title: Song of Santiano at a Potlatch
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs with contest of medicine after potlatch"}
comments: Meaning of the words is not known

songs.title: Song Concerning a Man's Tumanos
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs with contests of medicine after potlatch"}
songs.lyrics_translation: The man's tumanos is the same as a certain great man's tumanos (naming the man)

songs.title: Song Challenging to Contest of Strength (a)
comments: "It is a song of the Wyatch and is so old that the meaning of the words is not known"

songs.title: Song Challenging to Contest of Strength (b)
Song Challenging to Contest of Strength (c)
Song of Women's Dance (b)
comments: "It is said to be very old, and the words are forgotten"

songs.title: "The Other Tribes Are Praising Me"
songs.lyrics_translation:
I am telling what the other tribes are talking about.
I hear everything they say and they are all praising me.

songs.title: Song of the Kluklukwatk Dance (a)
comments: Meaning of the words was unknown

songs.title: Song of the Kluklukwatk Dance (b)
songs.lyrics_translation: Dance slowly

songs.title: "I Am Dancing in the Air"
songs.lyrics_translation: I am dancing in the air and dancing round and round

songs.title: Klokali Song (a)
songs.lyrics_translation: My dancer is the day

songs.title: Klokali Song Learned From a Slave (a)
songs.lyrics_translation:
The nuchin who lives in the woods is a man;
The klechin who lives in the woods is a man.

songs.title: Klokali Song Learned From a Slave (b)
"We Make You Join the Klokali"
songs.lyrics_translation: Here we come from above to make you join the Klokali

songs.title: "Ten Large Diamonds"
songs.lyrics_translation:
At a place far away there are ten large diamonds.
This is the news which the thunderbird brings to you.

songs.title: "I Possess the Salt Water"
songs.lyrics_translation:
Listen to me, I have possession of the salt water.
I feed your herring and fish whenever you are not able to catch them for your use.

songs.title: Lightning Dance Song
songs.lyrics_translation: What could be greater than that which I imitate.

songs.title: "The Wolves Are Howling"
songs.lyrics_translation:
The wolves are howling,
Let this be a pleasant day.

songs.title: Wand Dance Song - with 2nd rendition drums
comments: Different drum rhythms in different renditions; see publication

songs.title: Song With Impersonation of the Wild White Geese
Song With Impersonation of the Deer (a)
songs.lyrics_translation: My hands are my feathers

songs.title: Song With Impersonation of the Deer (b)
songs.lyrics_translation:
Representing a deer,
Representing a blackfish

songs.title: Song With Impersonation of a Little Fish
Song With Impersonation of a Raven
Song of the Horsemen
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Young Doctor's Canoe Song (a)
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}
comments: "The words are not in the Makah language and the meaning is not known"
Drum tempo is given in half notes

songs.title: Young Doctor's Canoe Song (b)
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Young Doctor's Canoe Song (c)
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}
songs.lyrics_translation:
On all fours on the water is my craft,
Flashing light is my craft.

songs.title: Song With Spearman's Dance
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Klikitat Dance Song
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Song With Changeable Mask Dance
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Makah Homatsa Song
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Homatsa Song (a)
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Homatsa Song (b)
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Nootka Homatsa Song
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Entering Dance Song
songs.other_fields: {"language_type": "Non-Tone", "language_family": "Wakashan", "social_function": "songs of dances presented at makah day celebrations"}

songs.title: Song of Defiance (a)
songs.lyrics_translation: You will not find my path, even if you do go.

songs.title: Song of Pintlachatl Dance (a)
comments: Drum and voice have different tempi

songs.title: Song of Pintlachatl Dance (d)
songs.lyrics_translation:
I have seen my tumanos,
Is your tumanos as good as mine?

songs.title: "Do Not Try to Imitate Me"
songs.lyrics_translation:
Do not try to imitate me in my ways,
If I invented other tribes I would have wolves on the beach,
Do not try to imitate me

songs.title: Song Belonging to the Last Makah Chief
songs.lyrics_translation: There is no tribe that can beat the chief in dancing.

songs.title: Song After Food Was Served
comments: "The song is so old that the meaning of the words is lost except that one sentence means 'A chief is in a canoe with many men'"
songs.lyrics_translation: [...] A chief is in a canoe with many men" [...]

songs.title: "I Am Trying to Look as Pretty as I Can"
songs.lyrics_translation:
I am trying to look as pretty as I can because my sweetheart is in the crowd.
He is the reason for it.

songs.title: Social Song
comments: Drum and voice use different tempi (voice=86, drum=72)

songs.title: "Do Not Go Away"
songs.lyrics_translation:
Do not go away when I call you. 
?oanak (meaning very poor, thin, unhealthy woman) came before she was called

songs.title: "They Come From Under the Water"
songs.lyrics_translation: They come to the surface, whatever lives under the water

songs.title: Courtesy Song (a)
songs.lyrics_translation: I do believe that person on the horse has taken the ring.

songs.title: Courtesy Song (b)
songs.lyrics_translation:
It seems that my husband is scolding me all the time.
(Some one is supposed to reply)
Perhaps he has a reason for scolding you.

songs.title: "I Will Not Have Him"
comments: Drum and voice have different tempi (voice=65; drum=56)
songs.lyrics_translation:
I will not, I will not have him because he is too old.
His head and shoulders are good looking but
I will not have him anyway because he is too old.

songs.title: "I Look Like a Sea Parrot"
songs.lyrics_translation: Of all the things that come with old age, I look like a sea parrot with white patches on the side of my head. Try to become old as quickly as you can, I look so handsome.

songs.title: "How High My Forehead Is Getting"
songs.lyrics_translation:
How high my forehead is getting.
This is the first time I have looked in the glass.

songs.title: "I Am Getting Old"
songs.lyrics_translation: What a pity I am getting old

songs.title: "My Dear Friend is Going Away"
songs.lyrics_translation:
My dear friend Wislatas is going away,
My very close friend Wislatas is going away.

songs.title: Song at Parting
comments: Sung partly in English, partly in Chinook
songs.lyrics_translation: Good-by, my sweetheart

songs.title: Song of the Crew
songs.lyrics_translation: I can see the snow on top of the mountains

songs.title: "I Hear the Bird Singing"
songs.lyrics_translation: I hear the bird singing in the high mountains

songs.title: "Stop Singing"
songs.lyrics_translation: Stop singing, they are beginning to make fun of you.

songs.title: Song of the War Club
songs.lyrics_translation:
Who is my equal or can compare with me?
I have forty whales on my beach.

songs.title: "I Will Not Cut Off Your Head"
songs.lyrics_translation: The only reason why I do not cut off your head is that your face would have a crying expression when I carried the head.

songs.title: Song on the Way to War
"You Cannot Defeat Us"
songs.lyrics_translation: Do not think for a moment that you can defeat us, for we own slaves from all other tribes, even from the coast tribes to the north.

songs.title: Makah War Song
songs.lyrics_translation: The Makah have no equals in numbers or strength. It is nothing for us to have 40 whales on the beach in a day.

songs.title: Song of Those Who Remained at Home
songs.lyrics_translation:
I have become weak by speaking of my home.
My home is a great home.

songs.title: Song of a Head Hunter
songs.lyrics_translation: There is my head (that I took).

songs.title: Song of a Returning War Party
Clayoquot War Song (b)
songs.lyrics_translation: Jump in, Akse'tsus, and take ten.

songs.title: Head Hunter's Song of Triumph
comments: "The words mean 'The head I cut off is bleeding'"
songs.lyrics_translation: Mine is bleeding.

songs.title: Song Addressed to a Shark
songs.lyrics_translation: Where are you, on whose back the waves break?

songs.title: Song to Bring Rain
songs.lyrics_translation: Rain, please come down and fill the depressions in the rock

songs.title: Song of the Man on the Rock
songs.lyrics_translation: You will always find me by the beating of my drum

songs.title: "In the Treetop"
songs.lyrics_translation: O brothers, here he has put me in the treetop

songs.title: Song of the Squirrel
songs.lyrics_translation: My tumanos is the squirrel

songs.title: Song of the Little Slave Man
songs.lyrics_translation: Whoever is knocking at the door is only pretending that he is my master.

songs.title: "She Will Pick Salmonberries"
songs.lyrics_translation: This little girl will pick black salmonberries when the women go to get berries because she is a sister of Kaka'ochuk and a daughter of Kaka'ochuk (a little bird with brown feathers and high repeated note).

songs.title: "The Other Babies Bother Me"
songs.lyrics_translation: The only reason I cannot gather more berries is that so many other babies are bothering me

songs.title: "I Wish I Was Out on the Rocks"
songs.lyrics_translation:
I wish I was out on the rocks gathering sidu. the tide is just right.
I wish I was gathering crabsm the early morning tide is out.

songs.title: "Let Us Go After Crabs"
songs.lyrics_translation: I think we had better go after crabs, they do not hurt so badly when they pinch the hands.

songs.title: "Go to Sleep"
songs.lyrics_translation: Go to sleep, baby daughter, mother has work that must be done.

songs.title: Song to a Little Girl
songs.lyrics_translation: My little girl is such a great care

songs.title: A Song of Prophecy
songs.lyrics_translation: Everybody will be afraid to look upon his little face because on his little round cheeck will be a xixitiyuk (belt of the thunderbird)

songs.title: "I Will Be a Great Warrior"
songs.lyrics_translation: I am going to be a great warrior, because the crows have given me medicine to make me so.

songs.title: "My Little Son"
songs.lyrics_translation:
My baby boy, my little baby boy, my little son.
You will put a sealing spear into your canoe, without knowing what use you may make of it when you are a man.

songs.title: A Basket Full of Snipe
songs.lyrics_translation:
What a nice basket full of snipe you are carrying.
You got them at Tcatca'tiks.

songs.title: "I Am Going To Be a Fisherman"
songs.lyrics_translation: Because my parents want to trade me for a good-for-nothing little old pot, I am going to be a good fisherman.

songs.title: "My Canoe Is Full of Kelp Fish"
songs.lyrics_translation:
Take your basket out and fill it with kelp fish.
My canoe is full of kelp fish but I threw out the bullheads.

songs.title: Fathoms of Wumpum Shell
songs.lyrics_translation:
I have for sale, for sale, 10 fathoms of wampum shell for a fishing spear.
It belongs to Klikababit.

songs.title: Song Concerning Kwati's Anklets
songs.lyrics_translation: Kwati's ankles are small from wearing such heavy anklets for so long.

songs.title: Bear Song
comments: Drum and voice use different tempi (voice=84, drum=132)
songs.lyrics_translation: I am hungry for salmonberries
